Articles.Content:
So, disturbing discovery (and no science points for it either!) made last night. If a rover falls over and the poor Kerbal driving it gets crushed...several times....and finally knocked off. They will stand up. Their helmet will not have a light on it, and they will be described as rover-debris. you can knock them over...and they stand up again. But it's dead! Debris! But self righting debris.

So disturbing.

...what can this knowledge be used to build....

A zombie kerbal kraken drive... squeeze them into a tiny chamber, then they get up, get knocked down because they dont fit, then they get up... that is motion without use of energy that could accelerate a craft...

Its been a problem since at least April of 2014.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75586-Master-Thread-Unresponsive-Kerbals-in-EVA

A zombie kerbal kraken drive... squeeze them into a tiny chamber, then they get up, get knocked down because they dont fit, then they get up... that is motion without use of energy that could accelerate a craft...

An Intergalactic Viking Rowboat! Oh the huge manatee!

A zombie kerbal kraken drive... squeeze them into a tiny chamber, then they get up, get knocked down because they dont fit, then they get up... that is motion without use of energy that could accelerate a craft...

Yes, indeed... physics holds no power over the undead.

Muhahahahahahahahhaaaahhaa *cough* erg

A zombie kerbal kraken drive... squeeze them into a tiny chamber, then they get up, get knocked down because they dont fit, then they get up... that is motion without use of energy that could accelerate a craft...

A spaceship powered by the undead Moon Zombies.... You know you've spent to much time on these forums when that suggestion doesn't even faze you.

There's a mod to fix this.

Sadly, there are some very old bugs that still haven't been fixed.
They don't want brains, they want fuel to go home.
